newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Swire, CMB shrs jump on flats sale plan.
newsitem.headline: Swire, CMB shrs jump on flats sale plan.

text.p: Swire Pacific and China Motor Bus shares jumped on Tuesday morning after Swire said it will start pre-sale of 48 residential units at Island Place at an average HK$6,282 per sq ft next week, brokers said.

"Anticipation that their earnings will be boosted by the presale of the flats, which are in a prime location on Hong Kong island, fuelled demand (for the shares)," said Michael Ng, analyst from ASG Brokerage.
Swire shares rose HK$0.50 to a high of HK$69.25 in early trade on volume of 132,500 shares. CMB rose HK$1.75, or 2.26 percent, to HK$79.25 with 12,200 shares traded.
Island Place is a residential and commercial development which is 60 percent owned by Swire and 40 percent owned by China Motor Bus.

Analysts expected the residential units at the development, situated in Hong Kong's North Point district, to net a total HK$4.0 billion if all the 784 units of the development were sold at the average price.
